h3.a: McComb Local School Update April 8, 2020: Meal Information

p.span: Meal pick up will be every Tuesday and Thursday.

h3.a: McComb Local School Update: April 1, 2020 Meal Information

p.span: McComb Local School
*UPDATED* Meals
The
meal pick-up is Thursday April 2, 2020 from 11:00 am-12:00 pm.
A drive thru pick-up line at school is from 11:00 am-12:00 pm (use student drop off traffic route).
A drive thru pick-up line at HYCO in Hoytville is from 11:00 am-12:00 pm.
Any children between the ages of 1-18 are eligible to receive meals.

span.u: SIGNED UP YOU DO NOT NEED TO CALL
YOU NO LONGER NEED MEALS OR NEED CHANGE YOUR PICK-UP LOCATION.

p.span: Due to preparing perishable food, anyone on the list that does NOT pick-up meals without prior notification will be removed.
Any changes in meals will be communicated via Ohio Alerts. Any future meal pick-up dates will be communicated via Ohio Alerts.
McComb School appreciates your cooperation during this time of uncertainty. Information can and likely will change frequently. Every attempt will be made to communicate changes in a timely manner.

br.span: Yesterday, Gov. DeWine extended the school closure through Friday May 1, 2020. McComb School will be continuing the meal pick-up plan as well as remote learning.

We recognize the upcoming challenges ahead within your households. As a result, McComb School will be observing “No New Instruction” days April 8-15. These dates surround the scheduled Spring Break which is April 10 and April 13.

During those days, teachers will not be assigning any new instruction, homework, assignments, etc. The “No New Instruction” days can be used for students to catch up on work, but more importantly, this time is meant for guardians/parents a time to pause, and quite frankly come up for air!
We appreciate all you are doing to assist in the learning process during these unprecedented times! Continue monitoring Ohio Alerts for updated information as well as the school’s website.

h3.a: McComb Local School Update: March 27, 2020: Meal Information

p.span: McComb Local School
*UPDATED* Meals and School Work
The NEXT meal pick-up AND SCHOOL WORK TURN-IN/PICK-UP is Tuesday MARCH 31, 2020 from 11:00 am-12:00 pm.
A drive thru pick-up line at school is from 11:00 am-12:00 pm (use student drop off traffic route).
A drive thru pick-up line at HYCO in Hoytville is from 11:00 am-12:00 pm.
Any children between the ages of 1-18 are eligible to receive meals.

span.u: SIGNED UP YOU DO NOT NEED TO CALL
YOU NO LONGER NEED MEALS OR NEED CHANGE YOUR PICK-UP LOCATION.

span.i: If you want ADDED to the meal pick-up list, RSVP from 9:00 am-2:00 pm, Monday-March 30, 2020 by calling the school. You must speak to school personnel on the phone, DO NOT LEAVE A VOICEMAIL. TEACHERS WILL NOT SIGN STUDENTS UP.

p.span: Due to preparing perishable food, anyone on the list that does NOT pick-up meals without prior notification will be removed.
Any changes in meals will be communicated via Ohio Alerts. Any future meal pick-up dates will be communicated via Ohio Alerts.
McComb School appreciates your cooperation during this time of uncertainty. Information can and likely will change frequently. Every attempt will be made to communicate changes in a timely manner.

McComb Local School
Meal Pick-Up Information
The first meal pick-up is scheduled for Wednesday-March 18, 2020.

span.u: *Multiple days of lunch and breakfast will likely be provided based on food delivery availability.

p.span: A drive thru pick-up line at school is from 11:00 am-12:30 pm (use student drop off traffic route).
A drive thru pick-up line at HYCO in Hoytville is from 11:00 am-12:30 pm.
Any children between the ages of 1-18 are eligible to receive meals.

span.i: To receive meals, you need to RSVP by 2:00 pm Tuesday-March 17, 2020 by calling the school between 9:00am-2:00 pm. You must speak to school personnel on the phone, DO NOT LEAVE A VOICEMAIL.

p.span: Any changes in meals will be communicated via Ohio Alerts. Any future meal pick-up dates will be communicated via Ohio Alerts.

span.u: School work packets for students in grades
PK-4 will also be available during meal pick up times.

p.span: McComb School appreciates your cooperation during this time of uncertainty. Information can and likely will change frequently. Every attempt will be made to communicate changes in a timely manner.
March 13, 2020
Dear Parents and School Staff:
For the last few weeks we have been working with state and local Health Department officials about likely scenarios and possible action steps related to the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) situation.
Ohio Governor Mike DeWine mandated a school closure for a period of three weeks.

span.b: McComb School will be CLOSED starting Monday, March 16, 2020 through Friday, April 3, 2020.
Effective March 13, 2020: McComb Local School will operate under the following guidelines:
All field trips are suspended for an indefinite period of time. Any out of district travel will occur only with permission by the superintendent or designee.
All after school indoor and weekend activities/events are suspended for an indefinite period of time. This includes all previously scheduled approved building permit indoor events.

span.strong: All extra-curricular activities and practices are suspended indefinitely during the mandatory school closures. All activities will cease effective 12:01 A.M. on March 14, 2020.

span.b: Students should be prepared for remote learning curriculum options if deemed necessary.

p.span: We appreciate the continued support and understanding as we deal with this situation that appears to change almost hourly. The school district will continue to monitor new developments and take the necessary steps to protect our students, staff and school community.
The school district will use Ohio Alerts and the school website to communicate all updates.
Yours in Education,
Tony Fenstermaker

span.span: If you are having laptop issues, please email Mrs. Cawley @

a.style: color: #1155cc; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: and she will set up a time to meet you at door #1 at the school to take a look at your laptop. You are not allowed in the building, but she will meet you at the door and see if she can quickly fix your laptop, or if it's something that will take a day or so to fix.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
div.span: She'll be available via email every weekday. She may not answer immediately, but will answer as soon as she can.

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Habit 7: Sharpen the Saw – Balance Feels Best! To be healthy and happy, we need to exercise our mind, body, heart, and soul.

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: I eat right, exercise, and get enough sleep (body). I learn in lots of ways and lots of places, not just at school (brain). I spend time with family and friends (heart). I take time to find meaningful ways to help people (soul). I balance all four parts of myself.

span.style: color: #333333; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 700; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Habit 7 Sharpen the Saw Family Challenge Activity Board!

We invite you to use the menu below to select activities or create your own to sharpen the saw activity. When your family has completed one or more items for each areas: body, heart, mind and soul, circle it on the menu. Then mark
We DId It but continue to challenge your family to sharpen the saw. See the board by clicking "MORE"
